meanings.definition: To live longer than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother hopes to outlive all her friends.
meanings.sent2: Turtles can outlive many other animals.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race to see who would outlive the other.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tree seemed to outlive time itself.
meanings.sent5: The vampire believed he could outlive any mortal being.

meanings.definition: To continue to exist or be remembered after someone or something has died or been forgotten.
meanings.sent1: The legacy of the great leader will outlive his passing.
meanings.sent2: The impact of his words will outlive him.
meanings.sent3: The old photograph outlived all the other memories in the attic.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness will outlive her in the hearts of those she helped.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins outlive the civilization that built them.
